text: R.l.P
author: NINTENDO_SONYFAN SOLDIER

text:
Something about the first 2 minutes of the song seemed very familiar to me, and i've figured out why. This sounds similar to the credits music from Yume Nikki. It's kind of sad, and kind of spooky. It both assuages you and gives to a sense of trepidation at the same time.

 But even though i just described it, it's like there's something about it that remains forever indescribable.
author: Hero✩Lydragius

text: Final Fantasy inspired throughout, I like it!
author: FullmetalHagane

text: I still check back here every month or so to see if you've finished dungeon 7 yet. I still remember you uploading the Fallen Temple one, and falling in love with it. Hope you finish this (so far) 6 year long endeavor soon!
author: Trent Blaser-Welch

text: Gotta love the face in the wall. Extra spooky!
author: Kasran Fox

text: I wouldn't say this fits Zelda but it does have a wonderful JRPG feeling to it.  Good work.
author: bkev93

text:
The music more reminds me of Dark Cloud than it reminds me of Zelda.

...Not that that's a bad thing.
author: BigBurkhart

text: Can I ask you something, SD? Are all your dungeon themes going to have this slow-paced, ambient feel to them? Because not all dungeon themes are like that. Just look at Great Bay Temple (MM), Dancing Dragon Dungeon (OoS), Fortress of Winds (MC), Forsaken Fortress (WW), Eagle's Tower (LA), Hyrule Castle (ALttP), Moonlit Grotto (OoA), Earth Temple (SS), Fire Temple (OoT), Snowpeak Ruins (TP), Tower of Spirits (ST), Great Palace (AoL), and even the dungeon theme from the original LoZ and PH.
author: CrysisOwnsHalo

text: This reminds me of music you'd hear in a tales of symphonia/phantasia dungeon. :) very nicely done.
author: Travission

text:
Here's the dungeon: nothing but fatal puzzles going up to claim a prize, and loads of enemies awakened when you decend with no puzzles. different music going down, of course :p
Reminded me of super mario rpg3 music, but more zeldarian. You, my friend, have some talent there! :)
author: DaisyEpicness

text:
I can definitely picture the whole scenario: a strangely comforting ascent, the intrepid descent...
Thanks ;)
author: Ocelot93

text: Glad to see you working on this project again.  Well done
author: AshCzarnaduch

text: Anyone else see the shadowy face in the wall?
author: SJT

text: I like this.. It sounds like something you would hear in either a town or world of an RPG..
author: Reginald Watts

text: the descent sounds more sad than scary.
author: Sayeth Di Puppeth

text: This is a very ambient theme for a temple. I can almost picture the temple in fact. Each level as you ascend is circular with grey, rectangular stones forming the walls. There are plenty of windows which allows light to illuminate the mist filled rooms. From a distance the tower seems to be dilapidated. However, as you draw closer to it, the tower suddenly becomes this massive monolithic structure surrounded by huge evergreens beneath whose shade you find a small doorway.
author: TheSpiralArchitect

text: Hey, any chance of you letting us download these from somewhere? Paid or free wouldn't really matter, just curious if I can get them?
author: Austin L

text: What program do you use for making music?
author: TargetHippo

text: Long ago, a band of ascetic monks abandoned all mundane comforts to head into the wilderness. They labored for years and build the tower monastery, and sat in rapt contemplation of the greater mysteries. They separated themselves from the illusions of life, and after thirty years of meditation, this came seeping out in the form of a miasma that surrounded the monastery tower. The monks were never heard from again.
author: Alex Arft

text: Very good Supra! To me the song has many different feels. I first thought at 2:41 it was sounding a bit like some of the compositions from FF9, but then it begand to sound more like some of the cave music from the original Golden Sun! Thanks for sharing and I look forward to hearing your next installment. On a side note, are these songs for a game you plan to make one day, or just something your doing for fun, and creating a backstory to help paint a picture for us?
author: Xzaithyr Grymhart

text: Nice! 0:00-1:23 has a very "Midna's Lament" feel to it.

text: The part around 1:52 reminds me of Thunder Plains from FFX. Great job on the track, and do you plan to release them for download at any point?

text: A very mysterious theme that fits with the back story of the tower. Looking forwards to the next dungeons theme
author: TheSeer

text: this is deep
author: gallerdude2000

text: Monsters now crawl everywhere and complex puzzles must be solved to reach the lower floors. The basement hides a laboratory where the tower's madman holds many terrible experiments. Our hero defeats him and departs for Dungeon 7.
author: SupraDarky

text: He finds himself in a gigantic room and ends up facing an evil statue responsible for spewing the mist everywhere. Once defeated, the mist disperses and words on the ceiling he previously couldn't read lead him to the dungeon's true boss located in the tower's basement. Our hero must now descend the tower. With the mist gone, everything is much darker/scarier than it first appeared (2:10 with the heavy bass). The mist was responsible for the illusions.
author: SupraDarky

text: During his time inside the Ancient Observatory (Dungeon 5), our hero found coordinates to a tower in the middle of a thick forest. While ascending the tower and its many floors, there's a strange absence of monsters and a lot of mist. Everything inside is strangely clean and even quite beautiful. Getting to the next floor always requires solving a simple puzzle, but in doing so blocks the path back to the previous floor. But our hero is determined to reach the top floor and so he does (1:52).
author: SupraDarky
